net.java.jddac.jmci.units
Class Converter

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.jmci.units.Converter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddConverter, ExpConverter, LogConverter, MultiplyConverter
public abstract class Converter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class represents a converter of numeric values.

Each unit A has an optional converter associated with it, accessible via conv=u.getConverterTo(B). The converter converts values from A to B, e.g. if A is feet and B is meters, conv.convert(3.28) = 1. Conversion in the other direction is via conv.inverse(). * A converter must state the scale type of its destination unit. The default is RATIO (and of course any converter to an SI unit reports RATIO). It is not required for sub-classes to be immutable (e.g. currency converter).

See Also:

Constant Field Values

IDENTITY

public static final Converter IDENTITY
Holds the identity converter. This converter does nothing (IDENTITY.convert(x) == x).

Method Detail

inverse

public abstract Converter inverse()
Returns the inverse of this converter. If x is a valid value, then x == inverse().convert(convert(x)) to within the accuracy of computer arithmetic.

Returns:
the inverse of this converter.

convert

public abstract double convert(double x)
                        throws ConversionException
Converts a numeric value.

Parameters:
x - the numeric value to convert.
Returns:
the converted numeric value.
Throws:
ConversionException - if an error occurs during conversion.

convertInterval

public abstract double convertInterval(double x)
                                throws ConversionException
Converts an interval, or a difference between two numeric values. While this is often the same transformation as other numeric values, it differs in general, e.g. for temperatures in units other than Kelvin.

Parameters:
x - the numeric value to convert.
Returns:
the converted numeric value.
Throws:
ConversionException - if an error occurs during conversion.

getScaleType

public abstract int getScaleType()
Returns the ScaleType of the unit we convert to.

Returns:
ScaleType of the destination unit. For SI units this is always RATIO.

equals in class java.lang.Object

obj - the reference object with which to compare.
Returns:
true if this object is a linear converter and this object is also a linear converter and both have same derivatives; false otherwise.

concatenate

public Converter concatenate(Converter converter)
Concatenates this converter with another converter. The resulting converter is equivalent to first converting by the other converter, and then converting by this converter.

Parameters:
converter - the other converter.
Returns:
the concatenation of this converter with the other converter.
